content.content: Asilo has always been a castaway cove carved out on the North Bay.
Miwok broke its ground with camps built in its lee,
their lives stretching on for millenium.
fumbling through the fog with their heavy chests in escape - they were the ones who gave its name.
But what do we have now?
No dragons or westward traders seeking riches.
The EaVille(EV) Corporation wanted us to take their money and sold us their promises.
Bad enough you have to drag your rag and bones up before the sun,
but you can't afford to fall asleep.
Where am I?[speed=fast] Ah yes - I forgot!
I'm just a high school student at Aslio High School.
I'm the protagonist of this crazy story
It all started that day in homeroom
The chalkboard was poorly cleaned over the weekend.
Mr. Johnson still isn't here yet,
As the corporate sponsor of Asilo High School,
we here at EV are committed to the ideal of progress.
We are happy to inform you that you are cordially invited to EV's Spring Gala this Friday at 7 p.m.
This gala will mark the grand unveiling project Elysium,
This event will be an excellent opportunity for networking and mentorship.
We hope you will be able to attend.
I fall out of my chair.
Just drop dead at stranger danger,
What's the deal with these letters?
Well it says "You are cordially invited",
so I think it might be an invitation.
but why did we get invited?
I know that creep Hanson kid got one,
but he likes to tell everyone how "connected" he is.
I think I saw Shaun ranting about it earlier too…
But honestly there's always a fifty-fifty chance some "imperialist pigs" will set him off.
It's the least they could do considering the trouble they've caused.
It would be weird if they didn't.
it can't be that big a deal.
I just hope that they are going to give me a free ipad
JOHN WICK IS AN OVERRATED MOVIE!
but shock commentary was the only way to get your attention.
I would like to introduce you all to our new student.
CLAIRE![effect=shake] CLAIRE,[effect=shake] YOU CAN COME IN NOW!
Just stand here at the front where everyone can see you.
Do you have any interests you want to share?
I'll have you know I won the California State Championship for Typing in High School!
It was a constant haze of running and hiding from the lesser evolved cro-magnon alpha males.
Incidentally most of them went on to have successful political careers.
sorry you had to see that*
The teacher can be a real nutjob sometimes
She obviously isn't much of a talker
I know it's bright and EARLY in the morNING,
but I hope you are ready to learn!
Today will be an extra special lecture on my FAVORITE topic,
If only there were some way to avoid this…
June appears to be busy texting on here phone,
Last week I had bought some run down gaming system at a yard sale!
Perhaps it can help kill some time…
I reach in my bag to find the gaming system buried in a endless sea of papers.
Has she never seen a gaming console?
I boot up the game and start playing.
The Emancipation Proclamation was an executive order from President Lincoln in 1863.
It was a document that abolished slavery in all Confederate states,
not any Union states that were on his side but still practiced slavery.
Although one thing was clear — the war was now about slavery as well.
And since this made the Confederacy look like direct supporters of slavery,
it also dramatically swayed foreign nations' towards the Union.
Wasn't she just on her phone?
do you realize how many lockers Mr. Johnson got stuffed in to teach us history?
She is definitely up to something…
She was using me to dodge the question!
this is an easy one and therefore everyone will judge you if you answer wrong.
Why did Lincoln give the Emancipation Proclamation?
Boosting Union morale to fight (Correct) OR Reducing the numbers of the Confederate Army
It gave the people in the Union hope.
The document inspired them to fight for reunification and individual freedoms.
no more pushing people in front of moving objects.
he was playing a video game!
I'm a public school teacher in America.
The only thing I can care about are the results.
He rambles on for a bit longer but for my own sanity I decide to just stare at the board blankly.
sorry for throwing you under the bus out there…
I didn't realize I was in the presence of some multitasking wizard.
I won't get on your case like that again.
it said that slavery was abolished in the Confederacy…
So obviously some of the people in the Confederacy probably moved away to some of the Union states!
somedays I wonder why I stick with this job.
I try to sink down into my chair as my face gets warmer and I feel the redness in my cheeks.
I look to my left and I see June Hanenburg,
who looks at me victoriously but trying to hide a bit of guilt.
Mr. Johnson continues his lecture and I look straight forward for the rest of class,
too embarrassed to see the class's reaction.
You should really take more interest in history.
You know people actually died to make it happen.
*sigh* But I guess it's not for everyone.
You kinda threw me under the bus there.
I try to fake a smile but I feel too awkward and dash out of there.
I make my way to the plain-looking hallway.
Rows of blue lockers and the occasional water fountain are spaced out between classrooms.
a boy and a girl arguing about something.
I don't recognize either of them.
Gift cards are currency in the same way cash is,
therefore I should not have to tell the clerk I paid with one.
If you buy something with a gift card and you return it,
you're supposed to ask for a gift card back.
that is not the social contract between vendor and consumer.
then decide to honor their return policy,
it is on the vendor to make financial restitution.
A gift card is given to spend at one place.
It's not your money to spend on whatever you want.
Who's money would it be then?
She catches my not so subtle eavesdropping.
they were being quite loud and I wasn't the only one who turned to see the spectacle.
if you are paying with a gift card,
you should get a gift card back …
I could ask everyone in this school and they would say the same thing.
You are just not seeing this logically.
I didn't mean for him to get mad like that,
I just thought you were right.
the girl looks directly at me to speak.
he always pouts when someone else is right.
Suddenly I realize that I only have forty-five seconds to make it to the gym before P.E.!
I quickly head in the direction of the gym.
I always thought gift cards were basically like cash...
you're the only one allowed to be right.
It was just a friendly argument,
I just happened to be right.
Elizabeth rolls her eyes and walks away.
I feel a little guilty for escalating the situation.
I'm sorry if I made things worse,
I just thought you were right.
The boy waves dismissively and readjusts his glasses.
I didn't realize it was such a controversial topic.
It didn't seem like the other girl took that situation very well.
I might have to apologize for what I did…
I check the time to see I only have forty-five seconds for P.E..
I speed-walk down the school halls as fast as I can.
I burst through the double doors to the gymnasium,
Coach Warren peaks his head up and his face contorts into a demonic visage as his eyes narrow.
Get your scrawny ass down here before I make the entire LOT of you run suicides up to the bell!
For the love of god Simon,
My heart sinks and the blood in my body grinds to a halt.
I hurry to the locker room and,
despite the layers of concrete separating me from the class,
feel their stares and the threats of violence they make if I don't hurry.
I stash my things in a locker and change into my gym clothes.
The miner buzzes and I curse for the trouble it has caused.
I step out onto the gym floor and see Coach Warren glaring at me through his narrow eyes.
His face is turned up like a boar that wants to cut me to pieces.
I was … gulp … playing a game.
Today's words of wisdom are from Machiavelli.
"It's better to be feared than loved." You best remember that,
I take my place in line.
Coach is only powerful if people fear him.
People are afraid of him because he's a vengeful maniac that wants to prove survival of the fittest.
Coach wasn't making an idle threat.
He's an utter sports fanatic who loves to run his classes through his sadistic games just for fun.
You showed Coach you were afraid and I judge you for that.
Coach only gets away with this because people like YOU let him.
you're not the one that would throw up half their lungs.
So you do have a spine.
I'm just trying to get through the day.
I don't have much time to respond before a soccer ball narrowly misses my head.
I hear an exclamation of pain and turn to see a student crumple to the floor.
The lady said she was sorry.
What do I keep telling you?
That the carpetbaggers from Palo Alto are out to destroy our very way of life?
And they can't be trusted because they're just looking to make a quick buck.
so stop trying to pass yourself off as a catamite looking for work.
that definitely seems like an overreaction.
First they act like you're allowed to be in the same room as them,
then they run down your dog while drunk and make YOU pay for it.
I've watched plenty of movies to know that the rich country clubs are never the good guys.
I'm sure there are … fine people … gulp … on both sides … of the equation.
Shocked expressions from Chad and Shaun.
What kind of pissant answer is that!
The high pitch squeal of a whistle sounds.
All students raise their heads and shuffle towards the locker room as if nothing happened.
I forgot to get a drink.
I walk over to a vending machine and swipe my credit card.
A soda pops out and my phone pings with a notification…
my phone must be acting up.
It says my available balance now has thousands of dollars in there!
I should call the bank later,
I scan the tables but can't recognize anyone from earlier.
and one with a girl who looks zoned out.
I've got some mining to do anyway…
I decide to have some privacy today and pull out the Miner.
Did I forget to pack one today?
I could have sworn there was a sandwich.
I look up and notice that the girl from the other table is now sitting across from me,
She smiles with a mischievous look.
She seemed to think about how she was going to answer that.
thanks for picking it up for me,
It was very nice meeting you.
She walks away and I can't help but feel a little confused.
Guess I should eat this sandwich before it's "dropped" again…
Looks like she could use a friend.
I plop down in the red chair beside her.
You looked like you could use some company.
She smiles sweetly at the gesture.
How did you know my name?
We have a History class together.
I won't be offended if you don't remember.
I'm just glad we've met now.
do you mind if I play my game here?
We can still talk if you want
I just moved into this area recently.
Not many people have actually wanted to talk to me.
Guess I just give off bad vibes or something.
I think my parents would say that about me too.
at least I've made one friend,
I think we're going to be great friends!
I think it's time to get going.
It was nice talking to you,
A herd of students limp out of the cafeteria.
A murmur rises out of them into a soft blend of noise but it does not hide their fatigue.
They exit in a dead-eyed march and disperse into a muddied quiet.
I pass by the library and see a rush of purple hair followed by a small gremlin.
I don't want to talk about it.
I think in the interest of friendship you should know that -
I just think you're having trouble understanding what I meant.
In a quick flash of movement Claire kicks Jack,
He jumps back clutching his leg,
his face frozen in an expression of pain.
By the time I finish processing what happened,
Claire is nowhere to be seen.
I'm kinda busy at the … moment.
In that brief moment of distraction Claire is gone without a trace.
All I did was ask why she came here.
Jack shuffles off into the crowd of students and eventually I lose sight of him.
I arrive in the computer lab and take my seat in the back row.
At the front of the class,
the teacher lectures about when to use recursion.
She's acknowledged the fool's errand of teaching high schoolers computer science beyond the fundamentals
- even so much as remembering when to not use a tail call is considered an achievement.
the students have free reign so long as they turn in a worksheet at the end.
I notice Claire sitting at the front of the class.
she looked like she was in another world.
Claire raises her hand and begins to correct the teacher.
I take out the gameboy and begin playing.
I make my way up the set of stairs to the third floor where the math and science classes are held.
I hear a voice call out behind me.
I turn to see Chad with Shaun following behind him.
I take it you got shuffled around when Mr. Braun left.
It's not like the new guy is going to all that bad right?
Maybe if you'd shut your yap,
Attempting to teach physics to high schoolers at the college level.
Are you even qualified for that?
I went to Berkeley for two reasons.
To play football and learn physics.
you came here to coach football and teach physics,
don't look the maniac in the eye.
The three of us shuffle into the classroom,
trying to ignore the coach's burning stare and guttural growl.
the students are already diving themselves into separate groups among the clusters of desks.
He's the one I was telling you about,
the one that got an invitation like the rest of us.
Did you really get invited to the Eaville gala on Friday?
Was I not supposed to be?
It's the social and business event of the season.
Those in attendance are power brokers from across the financial world.
there is more fortune to be gained from their connections than any honest living.
and have done so for the record,
for the opportunity to be in that room.
I am just trying to figure out why you were invited.
I just assumed it was a reward for hard work and merit.
Isn't that what these things are supposed to be?
I won't believe it until I have proof.
Me and Chad both found invitations on our desks this morning.
We four were invited because our close relations are in Eaville's ranks.
The two of you are an aberration to say the least.
It's a question made to the group but not intended for the group.
Jack and Anna are oblivious and only seem to register his indignance.
Yet Chad and Shaun are both looking at Elizabeth when she gives them a look meaning to "let this go".
What part of what I said did you not understand?
As many of you all know,
Due to a lack of options in finding a replacement,
and being more than qualified to teach physics,
I will be teaching you for the rest of the semester.
because many of you will most likely take physics 1 and 2 in college,
I will do my best to prepare you for that environment.
You all shall form groups and work on a packet about what we have studied.
I shall be available to clear any misconceptions.
the group done first will receive a reward of my choosing.
I'm sure the four of us can achieve … wait … Elizabeth,
To work with the smart kids.
like they have a snowball's chance in hell of beating us.
Absolutely no one in this room wants us guillotined.

answers.content: Work with Chad, Shaun, and Elizabeth
Work with Jack, Anna, and June

content.content: I do my best to ignore Jack's stare and take my place with Chad,
"Miller Time" evokes a carefree persona of a man that will hit,
I believe "Miller Time" is here to stay.
Saying it more doesn't make it true.
It sounds like he's a shill for a midwest beer company.
That's saying something coming from you.
I don't want to interrupt anything but we do have a packet to get through.
isn't the coach supposed to actually teach us?
He's teaching us how to cooperate with other people,
isn't that more important than physics?
But how are we supposed to finish the packet if he doesn't teach us how?
I thought your whole thing these days was defiance towards the "new regime."
I still want to go college.
But you don't have to worry about college,
Do you all have any questions?
and to be honest the rest of the class doesn't have a strong grasp on calculus.
We use it all the time in our daily lives.
I was talking to Mrs. Hendricks the other day and she said she missed you in English last week.
Would you care to explain that?
I wasn't feeling well that day.
You seem to not be feeling well a lot lately.
I think things have been giving everyone a hard time lately.
I just want you to understand one thing.
I don't really care what my players get up to,
so long as they make things right and not cost me the game.
I talked to my friend at Berkeley the other day.
You keep yourself under control and you might just get those papers.
Coach Warren turns away and goes back to circling the classroom.
We're all just trying to get by,
Hate the sin but love the sinner.
I take my place with Anna and June.
Jack can't resist making a smirk at Chad and Shaun.
The air fills with every spark that would indicate violence sometime down the road.
You made a good decision to join us,
The first of what I hope will be many.
It starts with a physics packet.
Pretty soon Jack will have you join us for lunch,
and then he'll convince you to be an investor in whatever manic investment group he starts.
Of course though that would imply that people actually join us.
Now what is that supposed to mean?
you have the general appearance of a gremlin and,
I'm scared of what you become if you ate food after midnight.
I … WILL NEVER … be like my brother.
You mean the youngest senior vice president in the history of a multinational corporation.
Why must you two be so cruel?
So what's so special about you guys?
All our families are part of the higher ranks of Eaville.
so we've known each since we were kids.
someone in her family works at Eaville,
I saw what happened between you two after lunch.
Jack what is he talking about?
A minor violent altercation over a perfectly reasonable miscommunication.
All I did was ask her why she's here in Asilo.
I asked what happened to her parents.
All I did was ask a question.
Now she has to live in a new place and the first thing you do is harass her for clout.
Her family has some connection to the higher ups of Eaville.
Just don't ask us what it is.
why are you accusing me of cheating?
Because someone that skips school shouldn't do better than me!
In a surprising display of self-control,
Without looking back or any pause whatsoever,
Shaun climbs the steps of the bus.
red and shaking from the breach of societal rules that were meant to protect him.
What was that about just now?
Who knows what his deal is?
he's probably related to Zodiac or some psycho on Wall Street.
Are you saying that you don't know who the Zodiac killer is,
or why he reminds you of Jack?
Something tells me I don't want to know your Zodiac conspiracies.
He's a little self-absorbed sociopath who cares more about appearances and success than his humanity.
Jack likes to brag about how he's connected to Eaville.
He's pretty much the poster child of everything they represent.
A maladjusted case kid that thinks everything else should go away just to get what he wants.
just look at what they've done to the town.
All the old things that made this place what it is are going away.
The bus pulls to a stop.
Shaun gets up and makes for the door.
Before he steps off he turns back and points at me.
me and Chad are going to be at the beach later today.
Feel free to stop by if you wanna hang.
We're in Mr. Johnson's 1st period history class together.
Do you mind if I sit here?
… So how was your first day at Asilo?
I saw Jack giving you a hard time earlier.
My day was fine except for that little creep.
But everything is just Eaville this and business connections that.
He's representative of the people killing the town!
Eaville can't just let things be.
Everything it sees it has to control and then change it into what it wants it to be.
but all I can see is it turning to dust.
It doesn't HAVE to be that way.
How dare he put his hands on me!
but maybe it was because you say things like that.
And then double down on it.
what do you recommend I do?
Just stay out of his way before he sends you to E.R.
I thank you for your counsel,
I turn around just to see the last school bus pull out of the pickup lane and doppler away.
Do you have any other way to get home?
To pick you up from school,
I'm just shocked you actually made a friend.
Christopher reaches out for a handshake and almost crushes my hand in his grip.
I can't tell whether that was on purpose or an accident.
Jack's older brother and the youngest senior VP at Eaville in company history.
I know what you're thinking: "How is that possible?"
I have a tolerance that defies all known medical logic.
is the little man still doing his whole edge-lord/uber formal routine?
what are you waiting around here anyway?
I missed the bus talking to Jack.
well you can just ride with me and Jack.
I longingly look at the door,
knowing I could go get some real food somewhere else in town.
Or maybe I could go to the beach with Shaun and Chad.
But am I really feeling up for that?

answers.content: Uh, I think you mean arson. Count me out.

content.content: I'd be lying if I wasn't curious about what those two are up to.
I quickly say that I'm late to meet with friends and take off out the door.
the beach is only a few blocks away and it only takes a few minutes before I arrive.
I cannot believe what is unfolding before my eyes
In front of me is a massive mound of twigs and sticks,
You are witnessing the birth of a revolution,
We're gonna hoard a bunch of wood and then-
[effect = shake] WE'RE GONNA BURN IT ALL![effect = shake] BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES,
You're gonna have to slow down a bit,
Then we'll all be on an even playing field.
and how exactly are we going to do this?
now we just need the stuff,
And we could really use your help Simon.
I knew you were one of the cool ones,
the descendents of Asilo shall remember us in FIRE!
We're planning on meeting up tomorrow on the roof during lunch.
I really don't think that's a good idea.
You are not welcome to the bonfire.
See you guys at school then.
still trying to process what on earth just happened,
I spot a familiar face standing opposite me.
don't let me interrupt your walk.
She refuses to meet my eyes.
(whisper) You really ought to make some friends,
I walk back inside and head up to my room.
I'm gonna go get something good.
I make up an excuse to leave and waste no time getting out of the house.
I walk down the quiet streets and notice a temping new cafe that I've never been to before.
My eyes gaze further and I realize also that Elizabeth is inside.
It couldn't hurt to have someone to chat with so I head inside.
I order a muffin and some coffee.
She nods and I start to consume my blueberry muffin.
I saw you and we didn't really get to talk earlier,
You simply couldn't help but hang out with royalty!
I was just here waiting on some friends,
I wonder where they could be off to…
Hard to get lost in this town.
Just as I finish my sentence,
two other figures enter the cafe.
Anna sits down next to me and June with Elizabeth.
Didn't know you were gonna be here.
I was just stopping by actually.
I'd be offended if you left as soon as we got here.
As I eat my muffin the girls quickly start talking about class,
and frankly I can't keep up.
They talk lightspeed and I haven't said anything in what feels like an hour.
I hate to leave you all,
but I should probably get going.
But you said you were going to stay!
You tried to leave five minutes ago!
Was it really only five minutes ago…?
I feel redness in my cheeks.
Many thanks for sitting down to chat,
still trying to process what on earth just happened,
I spot a familiar face standing opposite me.
don't let me interrupt your walk.
She refuses to meet my eyes.
(whisper) You really ought to make some friends,
I walk back inside and head up to my room.
It's been a long day already.
I don't need any more excitement.
I choke down the tomatoes and head up to my room.
I don the miner from my pocket when-
I saw him in that yard over there!
I look out the window and discover that apparently "that yard" is.
Outside was Jack's older brother frantically searching my yard with Jack in tow,
I head downstairs and around the side of the house.
Christopher usually acts this way while tripping.
Getting him home is a logistical nightmare.
I stare in awe at the claim.
I haven't seen him here in at least a few months.
Which way do you guys live?
He points in the opposite direction.
I pick up a rock and throw it into a bush in that direction.
Christopher's head snaps to see the bush and sprints across the street,
narrowly missing more than one car in the process.
As I walk back around the house,
still trying to process what on earth just happened,
I spot a familiar face standing opposite me.
don't let me interrupt your walk.
She refuses to meet my eyes.
(whisper) You really ought to make some friends,
I walk back inside and head up to my room.
